content.text:
# 1870 Monara colonial by-election

A by-election was held in the New South Wales colonial electoral district of Monara, also called Monaro, on 17 November 1870. The by-election was triggered by the death of Daniel Egan.
Dates
{| class="wikitable"
! Date !! Event
|-
| 16 October 1870
| Daniel Egan died.
|-
| 20 October 1870
| Writ of election issued by the Speaker of the Legislative Assembly.
|-
| 7 November 1870
| Nominations at Cooma
|-
| 17 November 1870
| Polling day
|-
| 30 November 1870
| Return of writ
|}
Result
}}
Daniel Egan died.

*Electoral results for the district of Monaro
*List of New South Wales state by-elections
